Our first web page will describe a movie you enjoy.

Base everything on HTML5 standards and make sure your text looks fairly okay on both a desktop and a mobile device such as your phone. (We will refine our presentation later, for now, just produce something reasonable.)

Here is the HTML5 Boilerplate default home page. It can, along with MDN, serve as a basic reference for all the work we are doing. Don't copy the entire HTML Boilerplate example page, just copy individual tags or elements from the page. Let me say it again, just to be clear. Don't copy the whole index.html page from HTML5 Boilerplate. Instead, just look at the particular tags referenced in this assignment.

Core Guidelines

At least meet the following guidelines:

  • Use an opening html tag with the lang set to English. More on MDN.
  • Add a meta charset UTF8 tag.
    • On StackOverflow. A bit more from StackOverflow.
  • Use a meta viewport tag to set things up for mobile as shown on HTML5 Boilerplate.
  • Use a body and head tag
  • Add a title tag
  • Write the name of your favorite movie using the largest heading tag
  • Write the name of the director of the movie and make the name italic with em tag.
  • Write a very brief description of the movie in a paragraph tag
  • Bold at least one word in the description with the strong tag.
  • Do not use a break (<br>) tag
  • Use an hr tag just before the paragraph element. Use your discretion, but you might want to use it to separate the heading from the paragraph.

When I'm asking for the html tag with the lang set to English, HTML5 Boilerplate has it almost right: 

<html class="no-js" lang="">

But let's skip the no-js and use English as the language: 

<html lang="en">

The charset and viewport tags on HTML5 Boilerplate are exactly right.

Make it simple, so long as it meets the requirements discussed in class. There will be an example provided during class.

Design

You are free to design the page as you want. If you want some direction, then the hierarchy of elements on the page might look like this:

  • html
    • head
  • body
    • heading
    • paragraph listing the director's name.
    • the hr tag
    • The paragraph describing the movie.

Don't forget to close the body and html tags. If you need more help, use the JsObjects HTML and CSS reference page.

The favicon

Here is how to draw the favicon: <link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="favicon.png">
